result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Chatmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to COUNT 2 and any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Bail on deposit to be applied first; any remaining balance to be returned to the provider.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.

-No contact with firearms.
-Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; no alcohol and drugs, unless prescribed.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to COUNT 1 and to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin Chatmon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin Chatmon in court.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Melvin Chatmon.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/ sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 2 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served.  Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, if revoked.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
-No new law violations. 
-Cooperate with agent. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; no alcohol and drugs, unless prescribed.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Bail on deposit to be applied first; any remaining balance to be returned to the provider.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Penalty Sheet Document, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Jury Instructions.

Defendant Melvin Chatmon in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery and an offer from the state, and are in a resolution posture. Court orders case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 16. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Melvin Chatmon in court with Attorney Michael H. Kopp.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Melvin Chatmon in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 039626,
Payable Number: 1001908,
Receipt Number: 22RP016665,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@02:00
